intro: Sonchus lingianus, commonly known as the silverleaf sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate, hairy leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with a sprawling or upright habit depending on environmental conditions. Its leaves are broadly ovate to lanceolate, often with a silvery underside, and it produces yellow flowers in clusters. It is often found in disturbed soils and can be considered a weed in agricultural settings.
